transportAdvice: Manila has a metro rail system and an extensive network of buses and iconic jeepneys that cover most tourist and commercial areas, though traffic congestion can make journeys slow. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available, but walking long distances is generally impractical due to heat, humidity, and uneven infrastructure.

weather.description: Cool and dry by Manila standards, making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Still dry and relatively pleasant, with warm days and cooler evenings.
Temperatures begin to climb noticeably as the hot season approaches.
One of the hottest months of the year with intense heat and strong sunshine.
Heat remains intense but occasional showers signal the approaching wet season.
The rainy season begins in earnest with frequent afternoon and evening downpours.
Heavy rainfall and the risk of typhoons make this one of the wettest months.
Peak typhoon season with persistent rain and occasional severe weather events.
Typhoon risk remains elevated and flooding can disrupt travel plans.
Rain begins to ease toward the end of the month but conditions remain unsettled.
The wet season winds down with decreasing rainfall and slightly more comfortable temperatures.
Dry and festive, with cooler evenings making it a popular time to visit Manila.
